inlineContent.text: - integrate in-app purchases and subscriptions in your mobile app in 2 lines of code. No server code required. Apphud works with all apps on iOS, iPadOS, MacOS, tvOS, watchOS and Android. Cross-platform support out of the box.
- view key subscription metrics in our dashboard and charts, like MRR, Subscriber Retention (Cohorts), Churn rate, ARPU, Trial Conversions, Proceeds, Refunds, etc.

- Send subscription events to your favorite third party platforms with automatic currency conversion. Choose from 18 integrations, including: AppsFlyer, Adjust, Branch, Firebase, Amplitude, Mixpanel, OneSignal, Facebook, TikTok, and more. Custom Server-to-Server webhooks and APIs are also available.
- Test different in-app purchases and paywalls. Run experiments to find the best combination of prices and purchase screen parameters that maximise ROI.
- solution overcomes IDFA limitations in the post iOS 14.5 era. Using this solution you can run paid campaigns in Facebook or TikTok and get real-time attribution with nearly 100% accuracy.

- Apphud may win back lapsed subscribers, reduce churn rate, get cancellation insights, send push notifications and many more using the mechanics below. This mechanics are called Rules. Choose between manual, scheduled and automated rule. Use our visual web editor to create you custom screen or screen sequence for Rule, and analyze user stats from every created screen.

content.text: The easiest way to integrate in-app subscriptions

inlineContent.text: Apphud provides ready-to-use infrastructure for all kinds of in-app purchases: subscriptions, consumables and non-consumables. Integrate Apphud SDK and implement 3 lines of code:

code: // Get Placement by Identifier, and then get it's paywall

abstract.text: Apphud is all-in-one infrastructure for your app growth. Apphud helps marketing and product management teams to make right decisions based on the data and tools.

Custom Apphud wrapper around NSError.
Called when user tapped on purchase button in Apphud purchase screen.
Called when the Apphud SDK detects a deferred or interrupted purchase. This can happen in scenarios like required Strong Customer Authentication (SCA), parental control approvals, etc.
Apphud class which describes products permission groups
Asynchronously retrieve a specific placement by identifier configured in Product Hub > Placements, potentially altered based on the user’s involvement in A/B testing, if any. Awaits until the inner
s are loaded from the App Store.
Logs a “Paywall Shown” event which is required for A/B Testing analytics.
Implements the mechanism for handling In-App Purchases initiated directly from the App Store page.

Entry point of the Apphud SDK. It provides access to all its features.
Called when user successfully purchased product in Apphud purchase screen.

instance from which you want to present given Apphud controller. If you don’t implement this method, then top visible viewcontroller from key window will be used.
A placement is a specific location within a user’s journey (such as onboarding, settings, etc.) where its internal paywall is intended to be displayed.

An object containing all incoming Rule information.
Called once per app lifecycle when the user is registered in Apphud or retrieved from cache. The
parameter contains a record of all purchases tracked by Apphud and associated raw placements and paywalls for that user.
Implements the
mechanism. This method sends the current App Store Receipt to Apphud and returns information about the user’s subscriptions and in-app purchases.
(New) Overrides action after survey option is selected or feeback sent is tapped. Default is “thankAndClose”.

Pass your own modal presentation style to Apphud Screens. This is useful since iOS 13 presents in page sheet style by default.

Called when placements are fully loaded with their associated Paywalls and StoreKit products.
Checks whether the given product is eligible for an introductory offer, which includes
, or

A public protocol that provides access to Apphud’s main public methods, describing the behavior of the Rules state and custom Rules view presentation
Called when the Apphud SDK detects a purchase made outside of its standard purchase methods. This is particularly useful for handling purchases made with Promo Codes.
User property initializer class with reserved property names.
Notifies Apphud when a purchase process is initiated from a paywall in
, enabling the use of A/B experiments. This method should be called right before executing your own purchase method, and it’s specifically required only when the SDK is in Observer Mode.
Checks whether the given product is eligible for any of its promotional offers.
This is Apphud’s internal class.
Determines if the user has active premium access through a subscription or a non-renewing purchase (lifetime).

An enumeration for commonly used placement identifiers in Apphud. Ensure that the identifiers used here match those in the Apphud Product Hub -> Placements section. This enum facilitates the retrieval of specific placement configurations in your code.

An enumeration for commonly used paywall identifiers in Apphud. Ensure that the identifiers used here match those in the Apphud Product Hub -> Paywalls section. This enum facilitates the retrieval of specific paywall configurations in your code.
Class for storing user data
Called when there is an update to the user’s subscriptions. This includes new purchases, updates to existing subscriptions (e.g., status change from
to
, or change in
An object associated with purchases container (Paywall).
Called when the user’s ID in Apphud changes. This is important for maintaining continuity in integrations with analytics services.
A public protocol that provides access to Apphud’s main public methods, describing the behavior of the user and the state of his subscriptions.
Called when there is a change in the user’s non-renewing purchases. This can occur when a new purchase is made or if a purchase is refunded.
Checks if the user has an active premium subscription.
Custom Apphud class containing all information about customer non-renewing purchase
Asynchronously retrieve a specific paywall by identifier configured in Product Hub > Paywalls, potentially altered based on the user’s involvement in A/B testing, if any. Awaits until the inner
s are loaded from the App Store.
Custom Apphud class containing all information about customer subscription.
Submits attribution data to Apphud from your chosen attribution network provider.
